name: RetrieveContactEvents
description:
Retrieve events for a specific contact in a list.

Use this tool to obtain detailed event information for a specific contact in a Mailchimp list. This is useful for tracking interactions or activities associated with a subscriber.

parameters.name: list_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Mailchimp list from which to retrieve contact events.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: contact_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the list member. This can be the MD5 hash of the lowercase email address, the email address itself, or the contact ID.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

parameters.name: records_to_return_count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default is 10 and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: return_field_list
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated fields to exclude from the response using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: subscriber_hash
parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

value_schema.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address. This endpoint also accepts a list member's email address or contact_id.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
